channel.title: Projects on Chris Turner
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Chris Turner

item.title: Societal Trends of the World
item.description: R Markdown Introduction There are many factors that contribute to a countryâ€™s standing with the rest of the world. The specific factors that will be explored in this project are the birth rate, gross national savings, median age, and the infant mortality rate by country. The birth rate compares the mean annual number of births a year per 1,000 people in the population. Gross national savings is computed by subtracting final consumption expenditure from gross national disposable income.

item.title: The Housing Trend in Melbourne, Australia
item.description: R Markdown Finding, Importing, and Renaming Data housing <- read.csv("~/melb_data.csv", header=TRUE) # the data set was imported housing <- housing %>% select(Rooms, Type, Price, Method, Landsize, Lattitude, Longtitude, Regionname) # six variables were selected housing <- housing %>% mutate(y=as.integer(housing$Type=="h")) # a binary variable was created housing <- housing %>% mutate(rooms2 = recode(Rooms,"one", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six")) Introduction Having visited Melbourne at the beginning of 2020 and a city that I could see myself moving to, looking at the Melbourne housing market is of high interest.
